summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of Jeffrey Epstein's life, including his career as a financier, his criminal proceedings, and various allegations of sexual abuse. It details his connections with high-profile individuals and the legal ramifications of his actions, including his 2008 conviction for soliciting prostitution from minors and subsequent civil lawsuits. This document discusses allegations against Jeffrey Epstein, including claims of sex trafficking involving notable individuals such as Prince Andrew and Donald Trump. It references a sworn affidavit from a woman who alleges she was held as a sex slave by Epstein and mentions various lawsuits and investigations related to Epstein's activities. This article discusses the rise and fall of Jeffrey Epstein, detailing his transition from a math teacher to a Wall Street investment banker and his subsequent legal troubles related to sexual offenses. It highlights his connections with powerful figures and the allegations against him, including running a sexual abuse ring involving underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the central figure in the document, detailing his career, wealth, and criminal activities.

persons.name: Alan C. Greenberg
persons.context: Greenberg is mentioned as a notable figure in Epstein's early career, having been one of his students at the Dalton School.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.role: Founder and chairman of The Limited
persons.context: Wexner is noted as a significant client of Epstein's financial firm, J. Epstein & Co.

persons.name: Donny Deutsch
persons.context: Deutsch is mentioned as one of the bidders for New York magazine alongside Epstein.

persons.name: Nelson Peltz
persons.context: Peltz is mentioned as a competitor in the bidding for New York magazine.

persons.name: Mortimer Zuckerman
persons.context: Zuckerman is noted for his partnership with Epstein in financing Radar magazine.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Weinstein is mentioned as a competitor in the bidding for New York magazine.

persons.name: Bruce Wasserstein
persons.context: Wasserstein is noted as the winning bidder for New York magazine.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Clinton is mentioned as one of Epstein's associates, highlighting the powerful connections Epstein maintained.

persons.name: Chris Tucker
persons.context: Tucker is mentioned as one of the individuals who flew with Epstein to Africa.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Prince Andrew is mentioned in connection with Epstein, with allegations regarding their friendship and Epstein's alleged activities.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is mentioned in relation to his conviction for obstruction of justice regarding Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Eliot Spitzer
persons.context: Spitzer is mentioned as one of the individuals who returned donations received from Epstein after the accusations became public.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Richardson is mentioned as having returned donations received from Epstein.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Bloom is mentioned as a legal analyst who commented on the credibility of claims made by anonymous individuals against Epstein.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Mentioned as having been called as a witness in a new case against Epstein and involved in a separate lawsuit alleging rape.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Reportedly taking legal action over allegations related to Epstein and denies having had sex with the accuser.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts
persons.context: Alleges she was held as a sex slave by Epstein and trafficked to several individuals, including Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is described as a Wall Street investment banker who became a disgraced sex offender, known for his connections with powerful individuals.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Wexner is noted as a billionaire who was a client of Epstein but has since cut ties with him.

persons.name: Sarah Ferguson
persons.context: Ferguson is referenced as a friend of Epstein who regretted accepting financial help from him.

persons.name: Kevin Spacey
persons.context: Spacey is mentioned as one of Epstein's associates, part of the network of powerful individuals connected to him.

persons.name: Naomi Campbell
persons.context: Campbell is listed among Epstein's associates, indicating his connections to the entertainment industry.

connections.description: Wexner was a prominent client of Epstein's financial management firm.
Epstein and Zuckerman were equal partners in financing Radar magazine.
Prince Andrew is noted as a longtime friend of Epstein.
Clinton is mentioned as having traveled with Epstein on a private flight.
Trump is mentioned in connection with a lawsuit alleging rape involving Epstein.
Virginia Roberts alleges that Prince Andrew was one of the individuals to whom she was trafficked by Epstein.
Virginia Roberts claims she was held as a sex slave by Epstein from 1999 to 2002.
Dershowitz is involved in legal actions related to allegations made by Roberts against Epstein.
Trump is mentioned as having social ties with Epstein and has been implicated in allegations involving Epstein.
Epstein and Clinton are noted to have been associates, indicating a social connection.
Wexner was a client of Epstein, indicating a financial relationship that has since ended.
Epstein and Prince Andrew are described as friends, with allegations surrounding their relationship.
Ferguson is the former wife of Prince Andrew, indicating a familial connection.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from minors and was sentenced to 18 months in prison.

events.title: Initial Allegations
events.description: A woman reported to police that her 14-year-old stepdaughter was taken to Epstein's mansion and paid for sexual acts.

events.title: Probable Cause Affidavit
events.description: Palm Beach police filed an affidavit stating Epstein should be charged with multiple counts of unlawful sex with minors.

events.title: Judge's Ruling on Prince Andrew
events.description: Judge Kenneth Marra ruled that allegations against Prince Andrew had no bearing on a lawsuit seeking to reopen Epstein's plea agreement.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: An anonymous Virginia woman filed a $50 million civil lawsuit against Epstein, alleging sexual abuse when she was a minor.

events.title: Allegations of Sex Trafficking
events.description: Virginia Roberts alleges in a sworn affidavit that she was held as a sex slave by Epstein and trafficked to several individuals.

events.title: Trump Called as Witness
events.description: Reports emerge that President Donald Trump has been called as a witness in a new case against Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Epstein was arrested after allegations surfaced regarding his solicitation of a minor for sexual services.

events.title: FBI Investigation
events.description: An FBI investigation was launched following allegations against Epstein, identifying numerous potential victims.

events.title: Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein negotiated a plea deal, pleading guilty to a minor charge and serving a short sentence.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted in 2008 for soliciting an underage girl for prostitution and served 13 months in prison.
Epstein's financial firm managed assets for clients with a net worth exceeding $1 billion.
He was known to have connections with high-profile individuals, including politicians and celebrities.
Numerous allegations of sexual abuse involving minors were made against Epstein, leading to multiple investigations.
Epstein's plea deal in 2008 was controversial and led to significant public outcry regarding the handling of his case.
Virginia Roberts alleges she was held as a sex slave by Epstein from 1999 to 2002.
Prince Andrew is accused of being involved in Epstein's sex trafficking activities.
Alan Dershowitz is reportedly taking legal action over allegations related to Epstein.
Donald Trump has been called as a witness in a new case against Epstein.
A diary purported to belong to Virginia Roberts was published online.
Epstein was arrested in 2005 after allegations of soliciting a minor for sex.
He negotiated a plea deal in 2008, resulting in a short prison sentence.
Epstein maintained a network of powerful contacts, including politicians and celebrities.
Allegations against Epstein include running a sexual abuse ring involving underage girls.
Prince Andrew has denied any wrongdoing in connection with Epstein.
